intro: Croton tonantinensis, commonly known as the Mexican croton, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its vibrant foliage and unique floral displays.
